page.title: 10TRANSPORT IN DONCASTER
page.content: LOCAL PEOPLE TRAVEL BY CAR,BUS,TRAIN, MOTOR-BIKE,BICYCLE OR THEY WALK.THERE IS NO LOCAL MAIN AIRPORT.THE MOST EXPENSIVE TRANSPORT IS A TAXI WHICH COSTS ABOUT A POUND A MILE.TRAINS FOR LONG DISTANCE ARE VERY EXPENSIVE BUT THERE IS A GOOD SERVICE FROM DONCASTER AND THEY ARE QUICK.IT TAKES 1 HOUR 45 MINS. TO LONDON ON A FAST TRAIN. BUSES IN DONCASTER ARE VERY CHEAP COMPARED TO OTHER TOWNS.A RIDE INTO TOWN COSTS 5P OR 10P FOR AN ADULT, 2P FOR A CHILD.THE SAME DISTANCE COULD COST UP TO 50P ELSEWHERE.THIS IS BECAUSE THE PRICES ARE SUBSIDISED BY THE LOCAL RATES.EVEN JOURNEYS TO SHEFFIELD AND BRADFORD ARE VERY CHEAP.THE MOST POPULAR BICYCLE AT THE MOMENT WITH YOUNG PEOPLE IS THE B.M.X AND CHILDREN PERFORM TRICKS ON THIS.
